title: What is the difference between intermittent and intermediate? - Quora

response.answer_text: Intermittent (adj.) is periodic movement or something starting and stopping in regular intervals of time. E.g. intermittent headaches, intermittent power outages. Synonyms: sporadic Intermediate (adj.) is being in between or in the middle of two extremes of a process or a state E.g. intermediate class, intermediate stop on route, intermediate steps in the process. Synonyms: middle, gray, grey, penultimate Thus there seems to be no similarity at all among the two words. Source: Find out how strong your vocabulary is and learn new words at Vocabulary.com.
Intermittent is which occurs at irregular interval whereas Intermediate is a median.
